text: The 1974 U.S. Women's Open was the 29th U.S. Women's Open, held July 18–21 at La Grange Country Club in La Grange, Illinois, a suburb west of Chicago. After a double bogey, Sandra Haynie sank birdie putts from on the final two holes to win by a stroke over runners-up Carol Mann and Beth Haynie had won the previous major, the LPGA Championship, a month ==Past champions in the field== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total||To par||Finish |- |align=left|Carol Mann||align=left| || 1965 ||72||72||77||75||296||+8||T2 |- |align=left|JoAnne Carner||align=left| || 1971 ||77||72||71||77||297||+9||T4 |- |align=left|Donna Caponi Young ||align=left| ||1969, 1970||71||76||79||73||299||+11||T7 |- |align=left|Susie Berning ||align=left| ||1968, 1972, 1973||73||77||75||76||301||+13||11 |- |align=left|Sandra Spuzich ||align=left| ||1966||74||74||72||82||302||+14||T12 |- | align=left|Murle Breer || align=left| || 1962 ||77||77||76||73||303||+15|| T14 |- |align=left|Mary Mills ||align=left| ||1963||78||76||75||75||304||+16||T18 |- |align=left| Kathy Cornelius ||align=left| || 1956 ||76||75||79||77||307||+19||T28 |- | align=left|Louise Suggs || align=left| || 1949, 1952 ||80||74||79||76||309||+21||T35 |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, July 21, 1974 {| class="wikitable" !
